title: The era of digital agriculture
abstract: Smart Farming and Digital Agriculture are the expressions most commonly used to refer to this transformation. The European Union (EU) has asserted that the most relevant technologies and techniques in this sector are satellite imagery, agricultural robots, and sensor nodes for data collection; Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) are considered to have high potential for aerial imagery and actuation. These indications are contained in the declaration of cooperation on “A smart and sustainable digital future for European agriculture and rural areas” signed by 26 EU countries.
